overview: From 2025-09-22 to 2025-09-23, elizaos/eliza had 3 new PRs (2 merged), 0 new issues, and 3 active contributors.

topPRs.title: chore: update zod pckg version
topPRs.author: 0xbbjoker
topPRs.body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **Chores**
  * Upgraded the validation library to the latest major version across CLI, Core, plugins, and starter templates for improved compatibility, stability, and security.
  * Aligned dependency resolutions across packages; no feature changes introduced.

* **Refactor**
  * Strengthened validation for configuration maps, ensuring keys are treated as strings for clearer error messages and more predictable behavior. No breaking API changes expected for typical usage.

topPRs.title: fix(server): reliable d.ts generation via build.ts
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
- Generate .d.ts via build.ts using tsc --emitDeclarationOnly
- Emit declarations into packages/server/dist via declarationDir
- Add types export mapping in packages/server/package.json
- Verified dist/index.d.ts exists and CLI builds without stubs

This aligns server with monorepo pattern (build.ts-driven DTS) and fixes TS7016 for @elizaos/server consumers.

topPRs.title: fix(build): improve TypeScript declaration generation and formatting
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Summary

This PR addresses TypeScript build configuration issues and improves code formatting consistency.

## Changes Made

### TypeScript Build Configuration ()
- **Fixed declaration generation**: Disabled  and  flags that were causing build issues
- **Added explicit types**: Added  to ensure proper type resolution
- **Improved code formatting**: Fixed indentation in the  array for better readability

### Dependencies ()
- Updated various dependency versions to their latest compatible releases
- Includes updates for packages like , ,  packages, and others

## Technical Details

The key change in the TypeScript configuration addresses a common issue where:
-  mode can cause inconsistent declaration generation
-  mode may interfere with standalone declaration generation
- Missing explicit type packages can lead to type resolution failures

By disabling these flags and adding explicit types, we ensure more reliable and consistent TypeScript declaration generation across the monorepo.

## Impact

- ✅ More reliable TypeScript declaration generation
- ✅ Better code formatting and consistency  
- ✅ Updated dependencies for security and compatibility
- ✅ No breaking changes to existing functionality

## Testing

The changes have been tested locally and should not affect runtime behavior, only the build process reliability.

topPRs.title: fix(plugin-sql): standardize PGLite data directory environment variable
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Issue

This PR addresses inconsistent environment variable naming for PGLite data directory configuration across the codebase. Previously, the system used multiple environment variables (, ) which created confusion and maintenance overhead.

## Changes

- **Standardized environment variable**: Replace all instances of  and  with 
- **Updated examples**: Modified  to use the new environment variable
- **CLI updates**: Updated scenario isolation to use 
- **Plugin-sql refactoring**: Simplified configuration logic by removing deprecated fallbacks
- **Test updates**: Updated all tests to reflect the new environment variable naming
- **Code cleanup**: Minor formatting improvements (empty function bodies)

## Files Modified

- : Updated configuration and constants
- : Updated environment variable
- : Simplified configuration logic
- : Simplified configuration logic
- : Updated test cases
- : Updated test cases

## Benefits

- **Consistency**: Single, clear environment variable name across the entire codebase
- **Maintainability**: Reduced complexity by removing deprecated fallback logic
- **Documentation**: Clearer naming convention that explicitly indicates purpose
- **Testing**: Comprehensive test coverage for the new configuration

## Breaking Changes

⚠️ **Breaking Change**: Users currently using  or  environment variables will need to update their configuration to use  instead.

## Migration Guide
